txt.en: Examine the Black Númenórean shown to you by Zaghárog

She is a woman of Númenor, possessed of a cold beauty. The images that float before your eyes are hazy and indistinct, but even so her beauty is tainted by the cruel expression she wears and the malice in her eyes.\n\n'Urudanî,' whispers Zaghárog. 'Gúrzyul.'

In appearance the creature seems similar to the Regmyl you have encountered, but its terrible majesty is an order of magnitude greater than those others. Even in the hazy dreamscape conjured by Zaghárog, this Great Rogmul is a terrifying presence.\n\n'Borangos,' Zaghárog whispers in your mind. 'Borangos the Horror.'
Hazy images swirl before your eyes of the delving of the Caverns of Fire, long ago.
Lord of the Nazgûl
Zaghárog presents you with images from the delving of a fortress in the depths of the Caverns of Fire, long ago.
Hazy images swirl before your eyes of the delving of the Caverns of Fire, long ago.
The Orc that appears before you now is different than those that served Urudanî, but you have seen his kind before: he is one of the Ghâsh-hai. What has Borangos done to the Orcs of this place?
'DNT - Blah!'
Burning Apparition
You have paid the price he demanded. Will Zaghárog consent to share knowledge of the Gúrzyul?
DNT - Blah!
DNT - Blah!
'DNT - Blah!'
'None, Mistress Stonemaiden! We work as hard as we can!'
'The Mountain erupts again!'
'A horror! A horror comes!'
Hazy images swirl before your eyes of the delving of the Caverns of Fire, long ago.
The Orc you see now is different than those that served Urudanî, but you have seen his kind before: he is one of the Ghâsh-hai.
'Urudanî... no more...'
'DNT - Blah!'
'Sauron wonders why... and sends his Nazgûl...'
Zaghárog presents you with images from the delving of a fortress in the depths of the Caverns of Fire, long ago.
'Sauron gained... a new servant...'
Zaghárog presents you with images from the delving of a fortress in the depths of the Caverns of Fire, long ago.
'... to replace the one he lost...'
It seems Sauron dispatched the Nazgûl to investigate
DNT - Blah!
'DNT - Blah!'
Examine the Ghâsh-hai shown to you by Zaghárog
Witness the images shown to you by Zaghárog
Witness the images shown to you by Zaghárog
'I shall take this place for my own.'
Instance: Fate of the Stonemaiden
Examine the image shown to you by Zaghárog
'Who comes to my domain?'
'Tell me of this Sauron.'
'I would speak with your lord.'
'You will serve me now.'

The woman is composed entirely of fire, a being of burning flames. She stares past you, sightlessly, and you hear the voice of Zaghárog in your mind.

'But the Stonemaiden returned... changed...'

The images become faint; Zaghárog will soon release his hold on you, and you must be content with what he has shown to you.
Zaghárog presents you with images from the delving of a fortress in the depths of the Caverns of Fire, long ago.
'I grow impatient with these constant delays, worm.'
'How many more of your kind must I slay to motivate you creatures?'
Zaghárog persists in showing you images of the past.
'Lord Sauron has granted me this boon: a fortress of my own in a place of my choosing.'
'I have chosen these Caverns of Fire to house my citadel!'
'The tremors are nothing compared to my displeasure!'
'Do they fear the shaking of the Mountain, or do they fear Urudanî Stonemaiden?'
'I will remind them not to cross one of Lord Sauron's Gúrzyul!'
'What is this?'
'Lazy maggots! Wretched slothful worms!'
'No! You will die for your intrusion, interloper!'
'Why have you stopped? I want my citadel constructed!'
'Aaaaaaaaaah!'
'My master is the lord of this keep. Come.'
Witness the images shown to you by Zaghárog
'The Mistress is dead! Follow me, boys!'
Examine the creature shown to you by Zaghárog
You feel a presence behind you
Witness the images shown to you by Zaghárog
Witness the images shown to you by Zaghárog
'Upon whose authority was this fortress completed?'
'Who claims now to rule Urudanî's fortress?'
'This is the domain of Sauron. None rule here without His leave.'
'Where is the Gúrzyul? Where is Urudanî?'
'He is our lord, giver of gifts and ruler of all.'
'He rewards those who swear fealty to Him.'
'You cannot take this fortress, but it might be given.'
